text: Added compatibility packages related to version six
title: Pull request merge from KamalakerDadi/nilearn:fix_506 to nilearn/nilearn:master

text: Eventually if we agree on a six version it will need to be added to both README.rst and nilearn/version.py.
After asking the culprits, I learned that version 1.4.1 was chosen because it is the first one with urllib.

> After asking the culprits, I learned that version 1.4.1 was chosen because it is the first one with urllib.

Yeah basically this was the oldest six version that got the test passing on my machine without having to change code.

For completeness:

```
~/dev/scikit-learn $ piprot <(echo six==1.4.1)
six (1.4.1) is 487 days out of date. Latest is 1.9.0
```
I have removed a new line

Add six to possible packages to install in install.sh

Also fix missing quote in show-python-packages-versions.py.
